image.altText: Joe Biden, George Clooney, Julia Roberts and Barack Obama stand side-by-side.

props.synopsis: Just a few weeks after helping the president raise tens of millions at an LA fundraiser, George Clooney is calling on Joe Biden to step aside. It's deeply damaging on several fronts.

title.children: Biden's refusing to back out of the election. But a big celebrity supporter just gave him a push

image.altText: Jen Harkness

props.synopsis: When Jen Harkness was diagnosed with Parkinson's disease, she was "shattered". Now she wants to bring together those Australians who develop the illness at a younger age.

title.children: Jen was 48 when she was diagnosed with Parkinson's. She was told she had five 'good years' left

image.altText: An embossed metal sign on a building that reads "Department of Education".

props.synopsis: A "psychopathic" paedophile, who later boasted of sexually abusing 2,000 boys, was employed as a Victorian Education Department school teacher despite declaring in a 1970s job application form that he was a convicted child abuser.

title.children: 'Psychopathic' paedophile was given teaching job despite declaring abuse conviction on application

image.altText: MDMA tablet

props.synopsis: The Australian Criminal Intelligence Commission has revealed Australia's use of cocaine, methylamphetamine and nicotine is on the up, but cannabis remains the illicit drug of choice.

title.children: Report lifts the lid on what drugs Australians used over the Christmas period

image.altText: The sign out of the front of the building and the crest, with an autumnal tree nearby and a blue sky beyond.

props.synopsis: The 50-year-old man allegedly approached the woman in Kambah on Tuesday night before allegedly biting her and head-butting her, police say.

title.children: Canberra man charged after alleged 'random and unprovoked violent attack' on woman walking her dogs

image.altText: A man stares down the barrel of a camera while sitting in a room, wearing all black.

props.synopsis: Alex Ophel is committed to stand trial in the ACT Supreme Court after an alleged attack at the ANU in September last year.

title.children: Man accused of attempting to kill two women at the ANU is committed to stand trial

image.altText: Black plumes of smoke rise from a factory fire in suburban Melbourne.

props.synopsis: Environmental groups are warning of potential health implications for people in Melbourne's west after a huge factory fire in Derrimut. Fire crews are expected to remain at the site for days.

title.children: Melbourne factory gutted by explosive blaze was recently put on notice by watchdog

image.altText: Danielle Wood productivity commission

props.synopsis: Most Australians are economically better off than their parents when at a similar age, but that's increasingly not the case for those in poverty, women, and people born after 1990, according to the Productivity Commission.

title.children: Rising poverty, stagnant wages and widening gender pay gap emerge as worrying signs in new economic mobility report

image.altText: A young couple pose, the man has his arm around the woman's waist

props.synopsis: A quarter of Australia's homeless are young people. While Chloe Hume and Trent Kiely are among them, a caravan by a river has offered them refuge from housing stress.

title.children: Young couple find shelter in a caravan after being left homeless in cut-throat rental market

image.altText: Construction workers building the frame of a skateboard ramp.

props.synopsis: The 18-year-old Canberran took up skateboarding less than four years ago, but to perfect her skills she had to keep travelling to Sydney. Now a new vert ramp in the capital has changed that.

title.children: 'World-class' skateboarding ramp modelled off Tony Hawk's is installed in Canberra

image.altText: Alex de Minaur plays a double-fisted backhand at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur's withdrawal from Wimbledon leaves Australian fans shattered, but Ash Barty is convinced brighter days are ahead for her compatriot, even if he is forced to miss the Paris Olympics. Here are the five quick hits from day 10 at Wimbledon.

title.children: Five quick hits: Ash Barty 'broken' for injured Alex de Minaur as Olympic dream looks over

image.altText: Alex de Minaur slides to hit a forehand during a tennis match at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: As Alex de Minaur sat and spoke about the dangers of sliding on grass, he had an inkling his Wimbledon campaign might have been ended by doing just that.

title.children: The 'freak movement' that ended Alex de Minaur's Wimbledon and why grass courts are uniquely risky

image.altText: A stylised image shows an identikit face of an older man over a corkboard background

props.synopsis: Today marks 30 years since the body of a tall, well-dressed man was pulled from the waters off Germany. Investigators hope tip-offs from Australia and genetic mapping may help crack the case.

title.children: This man's identity has been a mystery for 30 years. Investigators want your help to solve the case

image.altText: Harry Kane celebrates a penalty

props.synopsis: An injury-time winner from Ollie Watkins hands England a 2-1 European Championship semifinal victory over the Netherlands.

title.children: England through to Euro 2024 final after tense win over Netherlands

image.altText: Queensland Police Service logo on shoulder sleeve of officer's shirt.

props.synopsis: The CCTV footage seen by the ABC's 7.30 shows an officer striking a 17-year-old Indigenous boy with a baton three times until his legs give way and he falls to the floor.

title.children: Former officers 'sickened' by video of Queensland police beating teen with baton in watch house

image.altText: Older lady sits at kitchen table with a mug in front of her

props.synopsis: The signs of malnutrition in older Australians might be more familiar than you think but they are often dismissed as a 'normal' part of ageing. Here's how some simple changes could help.

title.children: 'Don't skip dessert, have the ice cream': Why older people need more high-energy food than younger folk

image.altText: An older woman named Irene Dornan looks directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: Doctors repeatedly told Irene Dornan's family she was not going to survive, and despite making a full recovery she remains stuck in a high-care facility where she feels she doesn't belong.

title.children: Irene suffered an aneurysm and was in a coma for a month. When she woke, her home and possessions were gone

image.altText: Silhouette of man in front of green screen displaying a Linux command window.

props.synopsis: Australia's cyber intelligence agency says a Chinese government-backed hacking group known as APT 40 has been targeting government and private sector networks here and around the region. But what exactly is an "APT" and what do they do?

title.children: This China-backed hacking group is accused of infiltrating Australian devices

image.altText: An eight-year-old girl with dark hair and wearing a pink cap sits on the knee of a person whose image is blurred.

props.synopsis: The court heard the eight-year-old was left in the care of three members of a religious congregation of which the parents were also members.

title.children: Elizabeth Struhs spent last hours on a mattress on the floor as parents slept, court hears

image.altText: a group of about 15 police officers standing together in the cbd

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's police minister is set to announce this morning whether a 72-hour snap curfew in Alice Springs will be extended.

title.children: Decision on possible Alice Springs curfew extension to be made this morning

image.altText: A lady sitting at a desk with lots of paperwork around her and a laptop and calculator

props.synopsis: Typically, people with more complex financial situations will benefit from having an accountant lodge their tax returns. Here's who that might include.

title.children: Considering getting an accountant to do your tax return? Here's when you might need one

image.altText: A screen shot of Tayla's video

props.synopsis: App-based rideshare services like Uber have made it easier than ever to travel. However, users have been left unsatisfied by the lack of action after reporting inappropriate incidents.

title.children: Tayla's Uber driver behaved indecently towards her, yet she was the one left feeling 'ashamed'

image.altText: Boxer Lemuel Silisia posing by a mountain

props.synopsis: Family and friends have paid tribute to boxer Lemuel Silisia who died in hospital days after competing in a professional bout in regional New South Wales.

title.children: Australian-based boxer and 'father to be' dies in hospital days after maiden title bout

image.altText: Bird's eye view of woman looking at an ultrasound scan photo while gently touching her baby bump.

props.synopsis: Australians are increasingly storing eggs and embryos but some clinics are running out of space. As the industry grows, what are the options?

title.children: 'Storage isn't limitless': As more Australians freeze their eggs, how are fertility clinics preparing for the future?

image.altText: A man with a beard and black hair in a suit

props.synopsis: Authorities say the man is receiving treatment for injuries after being apprehended in connection with the domestic triple murder in north-western London.

title.children: Man suspected of killing the family of BBC radio commentator has been found, British police say

image.altText: Hubble image of Omega Centauri

props.synopsis: Astronomers catalogued 1.4 million stars to find the black hole, 18,000 light-years from our solar system in the Milky Way.

title.children: A black hole 20,000 times bigger than the sun could help us understand how galaxies evolved

image.altText: A photo showing Jacob, with three legs, walking at night time.

props.synopsis: A record-breaking swim by two lion brothers, one an amputee, across a predator-infested African river is being held up as an example of how animals are making tough decisions to find homes and mates in a human-dominated world.

title.children: Cameras capture lions' 'record-breaking' swim through crocodile-infested waters

image.altText: A man with a beard sits in store room surrounded by boxes in a warehouse looking stressed, holding his nose.

props.synopsis: Work-related mental health conditions are rising, with time off work in these cases more than four times longer than for other injuries, SafeWork Australia statistics show.

title.children: When can you take 'stress leave', and can you be compensated for it?

image.altText: Suburban street scene from above

props.synopsis: It's a Victorian tax hitting up investors sitting on empty residential properties — but analysis suggests it could be missing roughly 90 per cent of so-called "ghost homes" eligible for the charge, less than a year out from a planned expansion of the levy.

title.children: Why Victoria's vacant homes tax could be missing most of the empty properties owned by investors

image.altText: Rhyan Clapham stands with his eyes closed in front of dry scrub with red earth and a pink sunset

props.synopsis: DOBBY's new album Warrangu combines his skills as a drummer, classical pianist, rapper and composer to weave the environmental and emotional stories of Brewarrina's rivers.

title.children: Meet DOBBY: the hip hop and classical composer rapping about his ancient connection to Australia

image.altText: Jen Harkness

props.synopsis: When Jen Harkness was diagnosed with Parkinson's disease, she was "shattered". Now she wants to bring together those Australians who develop the illness at a younger age.

title.children: Jen was 48 when she was diagnosed with Parkinson's. She was told she had five 'good years' left

image.altText: food scraps and compost in someone's hand

props.synopsis: A new organic waste processing plant in Tasmania's north-west means more households will be able to have food and garden waste, known as FOGO, collected. But it's not always easy to offer these types of services in regional communities.

title.children: 'We get some nutrients back': Farmer praises household composting as new FOGO facility opens

image.altText: Kirsha Kaechele and her fake Picasso.

props.synopsis: The 'Picasso' artworks hanging in a toilet at Tasmania's Mona gallery are revealed to be fakes, with the artist responsible saying during the three-year-long ruse she "fantasised there would be a scandal".

title.children: Artist admits to faking Picassos to 'match curtains' of gallery's lounge
